Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2008 10:52PM DianaT wrote: I found my lump on 12/20 and did not have a mammogram until 12/26, a biopsy 1/3 and then the results came in on 1/7.  I was going to have surgery on 1/16 so we had to sit down with the kids and tell them something.  I am glad I waited until I had a plan first.  We sat down with the kids (11, 6, 3 and 1 at the time).  My husband explained that I was sick and had to have surgery then medication that would make my hair fall out.  That is when my oldest knew and said 'do you have cancer?'.  Saying to my kids was the hardest.  Yes I told them.  My son (6) asked if I was going to die and I told him that I did not plan on it, that I was going to do everything the doctors said to make sure I wouldn't.  A friend was diagnosed with lung cancer 3 months after I was diagnosed and he passed away 2 months later, so a big fear came up for my son again when that happened.  It was scary for them after treatment because I was so sick (day 3 was my worst, then I would start to feel better).  Day 3 was Saturday, so the kids started to call it bad Saturdays.  Thankfully, that time is past. You will find the words to tell your children.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, question re: children, please guide me... gcpommom Rarity

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2008 06:56PM DianaT wrote: I ditto what others have said about talking with the teachers/administration.  My son had the most difficult time with it, but we spoke with all the kids teachers.  Whenever there was something big coming up (like the mastectomy and reconstruction) we spoke with the teachers again.  It worked out really well this last time, my son went up to his teacher and asked if he could sit near her.  She remembered the conversation we had at the parent teacher conference about the reconstruction and let him.  Later that day, she emailed me and told me what happened along with the fact he was playing with his hair again ~ he tends to pull it out when he is nervous, this started after I had lost mine with chemo. So when he came home we talked about how he was feeling.  I wish you luck, pray for strength and hope.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, question re: children, please guide me... gcpommom Rarity

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 09:02PM - edited Aug 8, 2008 09:03PM by DianaT I am also Her2+ on herceptin.  I was told when I asked what the recurrence rate is, my onc told me 25% based on the latest 'published' study.  More and more, he said that has decreased in his opinion.  My onc told me several things and the one that sticks out is that statistics are just numbers and can be viewed many different ways.  He encouraged eating whatever I could, I lost 10 - 15 lbs with the first 4 rounds, and gained 6 on taxotere. Also, there is a clinical trial that is phase III for Her2+.  It is a vaccine that is very promising and will also lower the recurrence rate.  I have not had any problems with my heart being on this medication, just a runny nose.    Your oncologist needs to be as comfortable to you as your best friend.  I would get a new one, if I were in your position.

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2009 01:50AM DianaT wrote: we are similar situations...kind of...LOL.  All my PET scans since initial chemo have been NED however I had a brain MRI 2/09 that showed a solitary 7 mm met.  Had that sucker cyberknifed and have continued on my merry NED way.  The med onc has said I am "firmly in remisssion" my rad on has said "NED".  When asked what the difference was, I was told NED is the same thing as remission as RobinWendy said.  I now see my med onc every 6 mos and continue living my life being NED and praying for a good 50 more years!

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2009 07:12PM DianaT wrote: My scans are over ~ COMPLETE REMISSION!!!!!!!! That is truly exciting for me.... I still have to have brain MRI's every 3 months and follow up with my rad onc.  Just wanted to share!
Posts.Title: Why is it.... DianaT lukejessesmom

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2009 11:54AM DianaT wrote: what ifs tend to creep in when we don't want them to.  I think your coping skills are great and if you need to turn up your music, pray more or whatever, you do it.  I used to ask what if God's will is different than my will and it finally came to me, that God knows it all, he understands what our minds are doing and we need to turn this over to Him.  Now, just because I say this, does not mean that those what if's don't come creeping late at night, when I am alone or have little to do, they do but I try my best to move on and think of all the things God has done for me.  I do not believe that my life is limited by cancer, it is a test/journey that I am going thru right now, but thru Him I will be victorious!

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 08:12PM DianaT wrote: Yes Lisa ~ push for avastin first! The average response time for avastin to work on RN is 8.2 weeks, so we scanned 2 weeks and 2 days early because if it was a met, the oncologist wanted a neurosurgeon to remove it immediately. No need for surgery now! I had originally asked for 3 treatments of avastin (it would have been 9 weeks then) but the onc won.  My RN started to grow 2 yrs after the cyberknife too, weird! I had the Brain MRI with profusion (not sure that is spelled right but that is how it sounds) and they couldn't say 100% what it was but the avastin and repeat scan confirmed it for everyone. Onc said it is beyond rare for a breast cancer met to regrow in the same exact spot that the radiation obliterated it.  Good luck and keep us posted!
Posts.Title: Good news - brain met/radiation necrosis & avastin DianaT rosasmommy

Posts.Content: DianaT wrote: I absolutely LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my oncologist and the NP.  Beyone the dr., the nurse is the reason I do not crumble into tears every time I have to go to the office for an appointment, test or treatment.  I had my herceptin treatment a week and a half ago, they drew labs for my tumor markers as well so I asked if they would call me back with the results, I am a nervous Nelly and my NP and normal treatment nurse know this.  No one ever called me, so I called yesterday and get this rude nurse who told me that I waited this long, I can wait another week until my appt.  Excuse me?! In the end she agreed to call me back, no call until this morning.  My CA 125-27 was 16 and my CAE was 1.0.  So I ask her if that is all ok, she said 'she thinks so'.  I have a f/u PET scan on Thursday and in the past my nurse has called me in the evening and gone over the results, so I request this again and the same nurse said, ' I won't call you, someone else will probably on Monday if you need us to'.  Am I the only one that requests this? My other nurses made it seem as if it was not a big deal to give me the results.  Even my very first PET scan after diagnosis but before treatment, my nurse gave me the results.  Am I being overly dramatic in needing to know? I think I need to get back on my anxiety meds again, because this is causing my blood pressure to rise.   Anyway ~ I am going to google the tumor markers to see if it is normal, but in the meantime, if any one knows off hand, please let me know. Thanks.  Diana Log in to post a reply
